Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

There was a post on monday from jirleech complaining about the
SeedFileIter=
ator not accepting dashes in URLs. I believe that this is the
same issue. T=
he reg.expr that matches URIs from the seed file assumes that
only a-z is v=
alid. 'Special characters' are not considered as they were not
allowed befo=
re. Clearly this needs to be addressed (the UniversalExtractor
also suffers=
 from this). I belive that this is simply a question of fixing
the reg.expr=
. but given the number of new legal characters that may be a
complicated ta=
sk.
 
- Kris

-----Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.=
com
[mailto:archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Bjarne Andersen
S=
ent: 16. j=FAn=ED 2005 10:24
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [=
archive-crawler] seeds with danish characters are not accepted


a seed lik=
e: www.p=F8lse.dk is rejected

If you cannot see the 6th char in the name i=
ts an o with a slash !

In denmark such names are now both legal and availa=
ble allthough most 
browsers don't support them without a plugin

How much =
would it take to get heritrix to crawl such domains ? (if the 
http-client =
can handle them ?)

best
-- 
Bjarne Andersen
